entry.title: No Mud, No Lotus: #mindfulleaders with Larisa Hovhannisyan #shorts

media:group.media:title: No Mud, No Lotus: #mindfulleaders with Larisa Hovhannisyan #shorts
media:group.media:description:
Watch full interview: https://youtu.be/yQfg2h0gYtg In this episode, we explore the life of Larisa Hovannisian, from her childhood and education in Yerevan, Moscow, Wisconsin, and Phoenix to her life as the founder and CEO of Teach for Armenia. We explore important topics such as her family roots, her journey in establishing Teach for Armenia, and the challenges and drives that helped her become a successful social entrepreneur. Finally, Larisa shares her view on the importance of faith, self-belief, life purpose, parenthood, social-emotional learning, and the role of education today.
About Larisa Hovannisian Larisa Hovannisian is the founder and CEO of Teach for Armenia, a social impact organization dedicated to catalyzing impact-driven leaders addressing educational inequity for all children in Armenia and formerly in Artsakh. She holds a double degree in International Business and French, a minor in Graphic Design from St. Norbert College in De Pere, Wisconsin, and a masterโs degree in special education from Arizona State University. As an educational activist, Larisa was nationally recognized by the Armenian government in 2016 for her contribution to the advancement of Armenia through her work with Teach for Armenia.

entry.title: Canada in Armenia: A Talk with the First Resident Ambassador

media:group.media:title: Canada in Armenia: A Talk with the First Resident Ambassador
media:group.media:description:
CivilNet host Patrick Elliott interviews recently appointed Canadian Ambassador to Armenia Andrew Turner. They discuss Canada's priorities and partnership with Armenia, exploring ways to strengthen bilateral cooperation across sectors from investment to peacebuilding. Listeners will gain insight into Canada's vision for the region and its commitment to supporting Armenia's continued development and security.

ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีถ ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีขีกึีขีกีผีธีพ ึีธีคึีกีฝีฉ ีฐีกึึีกีฆึีธึีตึีถีฅึีซ ีทีกึึ ีง ีฝีฏีฝีธึีดี ยซีีธึีฏีฌีดีกีถีคีซีฌยป ีญีธึีกีฃึีธีพึ ีีธีคึีกีฝีฉีซ ีถีบีกีฟีกีฏีถ ีง ีกึีฑีกีถีกีฃึีฅีฌ ีดีกึีคีฏีกีถึ ีบีกีฟีดีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีถ ีธึ ีฐีซีทีธีฒีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจ ึ ีฏีฅีถีคีกีถีซ ีบีกีฐีฅีฌ ีขีกึีขีกีผีจึ

entry.title: Armenian POWs: Bakuโs Objectives and International Law

media:group.media:title: Armenian POWs: Bakuโs Objectives and International Law
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Raffi Philllipe Kalfayan is a lawyer in international public law, an associate researcher in Paris Pantheon Assas University and the former Secretary General of the International Federation of Human Rights. In this conversation with CivilNet, he shares his professional insights about the legal intricacies of the detention of military and political leaders from Artsakh. He discusses the serious allegations made against these prisoners of war, the violation of their rights, the motivations behind Azerbaijan's actions, and the international community's role in influencing their release.

entry.title: ยซิณีฅึีซีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ ีนีซ ีฏีกึีฅีฌีซ ีฌีผีฅีฌ, ีบีฅีฟึ ีง ีญีธีฝีฅีฌ, ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ีพีกีฟ ีนีซ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีฌีซีถีฅีฌยป

media:group.media:title: ยซิณีฅึีซีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ ีนีซ ีฏีกึีฅีฌีซ ีฌีผีฅีฌ, ีบีฅีฟึ ีง ีญีธีฝีฅีฌ, ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ีพีกีฟ ีนีซ ีฏีกึีธีฒ ีฌีซีถีฅีฌยป
media:group.media:description:
ิฑีถีฏีกีญ ีถึีกีถีซึ, ีฉีฅ ิฒีกึีธึีถ ีซีถีน ีกีถีธึีถ ีฏีฟีก ิฒีกึีพีธึีด ีบีกีฐีพีธีฒ ีฐีกีตีฅึีซีถ, ีถึีกีถึ ีฃีฅึีซีถีฅึ ีฅีถ, ีธึีธีถึ ีบีซีฟีซ ีพีฅึีกีคีกีผีถีกีถ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถ, ีธึีธีพีฐีฅีฟึ ีกีตีถีฟีฅีฒ ีฅีถ ีฐีกีต ีฌีซีถีฅีฌีธึ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผีธีพโค ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีีฟีฅีฌีฌีก ีีฅีฐึีกีขีฅีฏีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีกีฝีธึีด ีง ีีทีดีกึีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึ ีกึีคีกึีกีคีกีฟีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถีซ ีฟีกึีกีฎีกีทึีปีกีถีกีตีซีถ ีฒีฅีฏีกีพีกึ ิฑึีทีกีฏ ิณีกีฝีบีกึีตีกีถีจึ ิฑีถีคึีกีคีกีผีถีกีฌีธีพ ีฃีฅึีซีถีฅึีซ ีฉีฅีดีกีตีซ ีฌีธึีฝีกีขีกีถีดีกีถ ีงีฉีซีฏีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธีฒีดีซีถี ิณีกีฝีบีกึีตีกีถีจ ีทีฅีทีฟีธึีด ีงี ีทีกีฟ ีฏีกึึีธึ ีง ีขีกึีฑึีกีฑีกีตีถีฅีฌ ีกีตีฝ ีญีถีคีซึีถีฅึีจ, ีฌีผีฅีฌีจ ีพีฟีกีถีฃีกีพีธึ ีง, ึ ีกีพีฅีฌีซ ีพีกีฟ ีฌีซีถีฅีฌ ีนีซ ีฏีกึีธีฒึ ีีก ีกีถีคึีกีคีกีผีถีธึีด ีง ีถีกึ ีพีฅึีกีคีกึีฑีซึ ีฐีฅีฟีธ ีฃีฅึีซีถีฅึีซ ีฐีธีฃีฅีขีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ึ ึีซีฆีซีฏีกีฏีกีถ ีพีฅึีกีฏีกีถีฃีถีดีกีถ ีฐีกึึีฅึีซีถึ
